title: Remember when some boards people flamed us for complaining about Rivens compensation buffs?
body:

While I agree that Riven should be nerfed to the level Sylas is at, I disagree with saying Sylas is gutted.

He's far from it, and his ability to maintain high damage and sustain with mobility is what makes him strong. His ultimates aren't actually a core part of his gameplay, it's sort of more like sugar on top.

Riven on the other hand deserves her winrate to go to 50% levels. I remember how everyone was suggesting Vayne nerfs, a common argument was that "Vayne should be a sub 49% winrate character because she excells in a tank meta". No shit, but her W is there to provide a way to duel everyone. Otherwise she has no attack speed steroid, no damaging spell, and relies heavily on ultimate usage. As a result, they hit her ultimate, and boom, <49% winrate. What baffles me is how when there were two champions that were extremely powerful, one of them was nerfed significantly, while the other one had her power adjusted. Just nerf her, don't bother with the compensation buff. Just because Riven doesn't fulfill an obvious single niche doesn't mean she deserves to have a higher winrate, it just means she fulfills multiple niches at once that are more subdued.

Actually yes.

Remember a good while ago one guy from Riot released a tweeter post talking about pick rates and win rates and one thing mentioned was Riven had the most mains, as a majority of her play rate (at the time 15%) were people with over 100 recent games on her (recent, not total). So 6-9% play rate being almost exclusively mains in her case isn't actually hard to believe.

Then again, the boards had it even worse. A good amount of patches ago, Shaco had a close to 60% win rate according to leagueofgraphs in D+, with a decent pick rate, similar to Riven's current 6-9%. Since he's my perma ban, of course I called it out on one thread where the OP asked for Shaco buffs (despite the bastard being a Shaco main with 80% win rate on Shaco in around 100+ games this season), and a hella lot of Shaco mains (I don't expect someone who's not a Shaco main to spew that type of thing) told me this: "Only mains play him, so he deserves a high winrate", when told that 8% isn't "mains only", they said that it's true, as he's popular and "fun to play" (didn't knew it's fun to play items, but who knows, maybe some have fun with it).
